item.title: SSH: Fingerprint Mismatch for Dual-boot Servers
item.description: The issue For server with multiple operating systems installed, ssh tends to fail with the fingerprints check: $ ssh 10.67.126.129 @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @ WARNING: REMOTE HOST IDENTIFICATION HAS CHANGED! @ @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ IT IS POSSIBLE THAT SOMEONE IS DOING SOMETHING NASTY! Someone could be eavesdropping on you right now (man-in-the-middle attack)! It is also possible that a host key has just been changed. The fingerprint for the ECDSA key sent by the remote host is SHA256:I4+yk7+wa9rETt+jKFZ2tEvmSecoXRsDYQc1G/f2exA.
